dt: {bc}loose wide hose or breeches worn in the 16th and 17th centuries

et: earlier also {it}garragascoynes{/it}, perhaps reshaping (after {et_link|gascon|gascon}) of Middle French {it}garguesques, greguesques{/it} (also {it}chausses à la gregesque{/it} "leggings in the {it}gregesque{/it} style"), borrowed from Spanish {it}gregüescos{/it}, plural of {it}gregüesco{/it}, probably for {it}*greguesco{/it}, from {it}griego{/it} "Greek" (going back to Latin {it}Graecus{/it}) + {it}-esco{/it} {et_link|-esque|-esque} {ma}{mat|greek:1|Greek:1}{/ma}
shortdef: loose wide hose or breeches worn in the 16th and 17th centuries
